meanings.definition: To regain control or possession of (a territory) by force.
meanings.sent1: The army planned to reconquer the lost land from the enemy.
meanings.sent2: After years of struggle, they finally managed to reconquer their homeland.
meanings.sent3: The king joked that he would reconquer the remote island with a rubber band.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a warrior ready to reconquer her independence.
meanings.sent5: The idea to reconquer the ancient city sparked a fire in his heart.

meanings.definition: To win back or recover (something lost or taken away).
meanings.sent1: The explorer set out to reconquer the treasure stolen from him.
meanings.sent2: With determination, she vowed to reconquer her stolen memories.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to reconquer its favorite spot on the couch from the dog.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a weapon to reconquer his attention.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes aimed to reconquer the beauty of the landscape.

meanings.sent1: The ancient empire sought to reconquer the lands it once ruled.
meanings.sent2: The hero's quest was to reconquer the evil that threatened the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to reconquer the recipe that had eluded him for years.
meanings.sent4: His determination was like a storm ready to reconquer the battlefield.
meanings.sent5: The athlete trained hard to reconquer the title he had lost.
